page.title: 18Churches
page.content: {St. Giles Curch, Hillesley, C of E.} The church is situated in the centre of the village. It was built in 1851. {Hillesley Baptist Church.}Usually called the chapel it was founded in 1730 and comprises the main chapel with a classroom attatched for Sunday school use. {St. Kenelm Church, Alderley, C of E.} The church is beside the former manor house (now Rose Hill School). The tower of the church is thought to be much older than the main body of the church. It is likely the church was founded in the mid 13th. century. {Tresham Church, C of E.}This is a small church on a hill, it was not dedicated to any saint. The church was built in Victorian times on the site of an earlier church. It was rennovated in 1908.
